concept_data.title: European External Action Service
concept_data.category_name: EU institutions and European civil service
concept_data.category_full: 1006 EU institutions and European civil service

summary: The European External Action Service (EEAS) serves as the diplomatic service and foreign ministry of the European Union, established to enhance the EU's global presence and coherence in external relations. It operates under the legal framework provided by the Treaty on European Union and the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union. The EEAS is tasked with implementing the Common Foreign and Security Policy (CFSP) and coordinating the EU's external actions, thereby ensuring a unified approach to international diplomacy. This institution plays a pivotal role in fostering strategic partnerships and promoting the EU's values abroad, contributing to the overall effectiveness of EU external relations.
